abstract: After reporting higher second-quarter earnings, Rupert Murdoch took aim at critics of his company’s $5 billion takeover deal with Dow Jones & Company.
snippet: After reporting higher second-quarter earnings, Rupert Murdoch took aim at critics of his company’s $5 billion takeover deal with Dow Jones & Company.
lead_paragraph: The News Corporation reported strong quarterly earnings yesterday, but the announcement was upstaged by Rupert Murdoch’s comments on the company’s recent deal to buy the publisher of The Wall Street Journal.

headline.main: Cable Networks Boost News Corp. Earnings
headline.print_headline: Profit Soars At News Corp., And Murdoch Looks Ahead

abstract: Stocks dropped on Wall Street after the European Central Bank and the Fed took action to ease the tightening credit markets.
snippet: Stocks dropped on Wall Street after the European Central Bank and the Fed took action to ease the tightening credit markets.
lead_paragraph: Stocks on Wall Street today suffered their biggest one-day decline since February after the turmoil in the home-loan market caused renewed concerns about tightening credit worldwide.

headline.main: Dow Falls 387 Points on New Loan Fears

abstract: The News Corporation reported strong quarterly earnings Wednesday, but the announcement was upstaged by Rupert Murdoch’s comments on the company’s recent deal to buy the publisher of The Wall Street Journal.
lead_paragraph: The News Corporation reported strong quarterly earnings Wednesday, but the announcement was upstaged by Rupert Murdoch’s comments on the company’s recent deal to buy the publisher of The Wall Street Journal.

headline.main: Murdoch’s Dow Comments Eclipse News Corp. Earnings

abstract: With Dow Jones & Company set to become part of Rupert Murdoch’s media empire, Gannett is sometimes touted as the next potential takeover target in the newspaper industry. But it is so huge — with a market capitalization of nearly $11 billion — that it is hard to imagine who the acquirer would be. Jon Morton, a newspaper analyst, told The New York Times in June that only a big, non-media buyer — he mentioned General Electric or a buyout firm — could possibly do such a deal, and even that’s unlikely.
lead_paragraph: With Dow Jones & Company set to become part of Rupert Murdoch’s media empire, Gannett is sometimes touted as the next potential takeover target in the newspaper industry. But it is so huge — with a market capitalization of nearly $11 billion — that it is hard to imagine who the acquirer would be. Jon Morton, a newspaper analyst, told The New York Times in June that only a big, non-media buyer — he mentioned General Electric or a buyout firm — could possibly do such a deal, and even that’s unlikely.
